constituent: village, rice field, brains, street, nail, spike
heisigStory: Street signs standing at the corner of the rice fields depict the village limits. (Remember what was said earlier: when used as a primitive, a kanji may either take its primitive meaning or revert to the original meaning of its key word.)
koohiiStory1: Actually this means town, like one that has lots of streets and is surrounded by all the rice fields.
koohiiStory2: Getting this one confused with Town is easy, so remember it with this rhyme. "Pillage the village, for the rice and and the tea." the street primitive on the right looks like a ´t´.
myStory: làng. phố gần ruộng là làng
